alert.note: Alert for Dent; Phelps (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 5:52PM CDT until August 08 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Phelps County in east central Missouri... Northwestern Dent County in south central Missouri... * Until midnight CDT Monday. * At 552 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across northern Dent County. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in portions of the Hyer Branch and Dry Fork Creek basins. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in northern Dent County, but will also flow into portions of eastern Phelps County. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lake Spring, Anutt, Lecoma, Bangert, Howes and Lenox. The Hyers Branch and Dry Fork Creek in northern Dent County and eastern Phelps County are expected to experience significant rises within the next few hours. This includes the following low water crossings... Norman Creek at County Road 4220. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
